page.title: 16Brett Marine Aggregates
page.content: { Brett Marine Aggregates}is a sand and gravel depot next to{Salfords Railway {Station.}It has been in operation for {9 years.}The{sand and gravel}is delivered by train from Cliffe near Rochester, Kent. The train branches off the London to Brighton line into the depot. On average 3 trains come in a week. There are usually 9 trucks a train. When full all trucks weigh 648 tonnes.There is 1 type of sand and 3 types of gravel both of which have been dredged from the{seabed in {Norfolk.}The sand and gravel are loaded onto lorries by a machine called a loading shovel. Before leaving the depot the lorry plus its load is weighed. Most of the sand and gravel is contracted out for the construction of roads and buildings.
